intro: Codonoboea dentata, commonly known as the serrated codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
